question_stem.en: A 17-year-old right-handed boy is brought to the emergency department due to brief loss of consciousness after colliding with another player during a football game. The patient reports "fogginess" but has had no headache, vomiting, focal weakness or numbness, or seizures. He has no other medical conditions and takes no medications. Vital signs are within normal limits. On physical examination, the patient demonstrates retrograde amnesia about the game but no focal neurologic deficits. CT angiography of the head reveals no skull fractures or intracranial bleeding, but a small lesion in the left temporoparietal region composed of abnormal vascular channels is noted and is shown in the exhibit. {{exhibit_1}} Without treatment of this abnormality, which of the following will most likely occur in this patient?
question_stem.zh: 一名17岁右利手男孩因在橄榄球比赛中与其他球员相撞后短暂意识丧失而被送往急诊科。患者报告“头脑昏沉”，但没有头痛、呕吐、局灶性无力或麻木，或癫痫发作。他没有其他疾病，也没有服用药物。生命体征在正常范围内。体格检查显示，患者对比赛有逆行性遗忘，但没有局灶性神经功能缺损。头部CT血管造影显示没有颅骨骨折或颅内出血，但注意到左侧颞顶叶区域有一个由异常血管通道组成的小病灶，如图片所示。{{exhibit_1}} 未经治疗，该患者最有可能发生以下哪种情况？

question.en: Without treatment of this abnormality, which of the following will most likely occur in this patient?
question.zh: 未经治疗这种异常情况，患者最有可能发生以下哪种情况？

explanation.en:
This young patient most likely sustained a concussion. Because he lost consciousness and has retrograde amnesia, imaging is performed to evaluate for intracranial hemorrhage. Incidentally, the CT angiogram reveals a cluster of dilated vessels (ie, "bag of worms") in the left temporoparietal region with large arterial feeder vessels. This is consistent with an ARTERIOVENOUS MALFORMATION (AVM). {{exhibit_2}} AVMs occur when an ARTERY directly ANASTOMOSES with VEINS without an interposed capillary bed. The resulting high-pressure blood flow through weak vessels (ie, veins) predisposes patients to aneurysm formation and/or SPONTANEOUS HEMORRHAGE. Seizures also commonly develop and may be due to local accumulation of hemosiderin, a cortical irritant, from microbleeds. Most AVMs are congenital and sporadic. They can occasionally occur as a component of hereditary hemorrhagic telangiectasia (ie, Osler-Weber-Rendu syndrome), an autosomal dominant disorder associated with mucocutaneous telangiectasias (eg, nasal mucosa, intestinal mucosa) and multiorgan AVMs (eg, lungs, liver, brain).
(Choice A) The pulmonary capillaries filter potential debris from the venous blood (eg, clots, bacteria), preventing it from entering the systemic circulation. A pulmonary AVM (but not a cerebral AVM) bypasses this filtering system, leading to paradoxical embolization into the systemic arteries (eg, stroke or brain abscess).
(Choice B) Flaccid paralysis can occur with lesions that affect the peripheral nervous system. However, lesions in the CNS lead to upper motor neuron signs (eg, spastic paralysis, hyperreflexia). In addition, cerebral AVMs very rarely lead to motor deficits.
(Choice C) AVMs are congenital malformations rather than neoplastic proliferations. Therefore, they are not at risk of malignant transformation.
(Choice E) Although some cerebral AVMs are stable and do not lead to either seizures or intracerebral hemorrhage, they never resolve spontaneously.
Educational objective:
Arteriovenous malformations occur when an artery directly anastomoses with veins without an interposed capillary bed. They may result in spontaneous intracerebral hemorrhage or seizures, or they may be discovered incidentally when brain imaging is obtained for another reason.
explanation.zh:
这位年轻患者很可能遭受了脑震荡。因为他失去了意识并有逆行性遗忘，所以进行影像学检查以评估颅内出血。偶然的是，CT血管造影显示左颞顶叶区域有一簇扩张的血管（即“蠕虫囊”），伴有大的动脉供血血管。这与动静脉畸形 (AVM) 相符。{{exhibit_2}} 当动脉与静脉直接吻合而没有中间毛细血管床时，就会发生动静脉畸形。由此导致的高压血流通过薄弱的血管（即静脉）使患者易于发生动脉瘤形成和/或自发性出血。癫痫发作也很常见，这可能是由于微出血引起的局部血铁黄素（一种皮质刺激物）积聚所致。大多数动静脉畸形是先天性和散发的。它们偶尔会作为遗传性出血性毛细血管扩张症（即 Osler-Weber-Rendu 综合征）的一个组成部分出现，这是一种常染色体显性遗传疾病，与皮肤黏膜毛细血管扩张症（例如，鼻黏膜、肠黏膜）和多器官动静脉畸形（例如，肺、肝、脑）相关。
(选项 A) 肺毛细血管过滤来自静脉血的潜在碎片（例如，血凝块、细菌），阻止其进入体循环。肺动静脉畸形（而非脑动静脉畸形）绕过了这个过滤系统，导致反常性栓塞进入体循环动脉（例如，中风或脑脓肿）。
(选项 B) 弛缓性麻痹可能发生在影响周围神经系统的病变中。然而，中枢神经系统的病变会导致上运动神经元征象（例如，痉挛性麻痹、反射亢进）。此外，脑动静脉畸形很少导致运动功能缺损。
(选项 C) 动静脉畸形是先天性畸形，而不是肿瘤性增生。因此，它们没有恶性转化的风险。
(选项 E) 虽然一些脑动静脉畸形是稳定的，并且不会导致癫痫发作或脑内出血，但它们永远不会自发消退。
教育目标：
当动脉与静脉直接吻合而没有中间毛细血管床时，就会发生动静脉畸形。它们可能导致自发性脑内出血或癫痫发作，或者当因其他原因进行脑部影像学检查时可能会偶然发现它们。

summary.en:
This question tests the understanding of the pathophysiology and clinical manifestations of cerebral arteriovenous malformations (AVMs). It assesses the ability to recognize AVMs on imaging and predict their most likely complication.
To solve this question, one must identify the "bag of worms" appearance on CT angiography as indicative of an AVM. Understanding that AVMs bypass the capillary bed leads to high-pressure venous flow, predisposing to hemorrhage. The other options are less likely complications or are incorrect associations with AVMs.
summary.zh:
本题考察对脑动静脉畸形 (AVM) 的病理生理学和临床表现的理解。它评估了在影像学上识别动静脉畸形并预测其最可能并发症的能力。
要解决这个问题，必须将 CT 血管造影上的“蠕虫囊”外观识别为动静脉畸形的征兆。了解动静脉畸形绕过毛细血管床会导致高压静脉血流，从而易于发生出血。其他选项是可能性较小的并发症或与动静脉畸形的错误关联。
